meanings.sent1: The slime on the frog's skin helped it stay moist.
meanings.sent2: I slipped on the slime left by the snail.
meanings.sent3: The kids had fun playing with slime at the party.
meanings.sent4: The slime oozed slowly down the tree trunk.
meanings.sent5: The slime felt cold and squishy in my hands.

meanings.definition: To cover or smear with slime
meanings.sent1: She decided to slime her hands with the gooey substance.
meanings.sent2: The monster tried to slime the hero with its sticky tentacles.
meanings.sent3: The prankster planned to slime his friend during the game.
meanings.sent4: The mud seemed to slime over everything in the yard after the rain.
meanings.sent5: The chef accidentally slimes the kitchen floor with the spilled sauce.

meanings.sent1: The villain in the movie was portrayed as a slime who betrayed everyone.
meanings.sent2: I can't believe he turned out to be such a slime after all.
meanings.sent3: The slime tried to cheat his way to the top but failed miserably.
meanings.sent4: She realized her so-called friend was nothing but a slime in disguise.
meanings.sent5: The politician was exposed as a slime who had been lying to the public.
